intro: Alseodaphne huanglianshanensis, commonly known as the Huanglianshan alseodaphne, is a rare evergreen tree native to China. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite, and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
